text: - One of my biggest strengths is being underestimated.
- I played a phenomenal game that I'm not ashamed of.
- Oh my God, no way.
[whistles]
One of the things that was really important to me in doing this show
was to prove my worth to myself
and to, you know, everyone else.
And also one thing that was really important to me
was to get back to being
my normal, like, fun, enthusiastic self.
The things that, that really make me, me.
The things that I love about myself.
I don't know, man.
I feel like a lot of the people who know me from “Vanderpump Rules”
did not expect me to last.

I feel like they were wanting and looking
forward to seeing me fail miserably,
which is fine.

Like, one of my biggest strengths
is being underestimated.
[laughs]
- It's been 20 plus years since I really played a reality competition.
I knew it was important to be, to me to play this game ruthless,
and I had to protect my feelings or basically push my feelings to the side
and say, “I'm going to do whatever I need to do to win this game.”
In my real life, I am strong, confident, and I'm here to rock the world,
but in that castle, I had to become something that I'm not naturally.
And even in the beginning of the game, I thought I had ice in my veins,
and my heart was full of cement, and it was hardened.
But as I progressed in the game, I started getting to know these people,
and the guilt was so overwhelming.

There were points I was in the game,
I was like, “I wish I was a Faithful.”
It was so awful in that turret.

I mean, the stuff I was going through
playing that game was just so stressful,
so stressful.
- The high point of the game for me
was leading the charge against Boston Rob
and finally getting him out.
So I felt like my credibility,
you know, went up significantly.
When I didn't get murdered in the church,
I knew immediately that somebody
who I had completely and totally trusted must be a Traitor.
I kind of sort of took a step back the next day

and really sort of thought and concentrated
on who that could possibly be.
The signs started to point towards
both Danielle and Carolyn.

Carolyn and I both connected on the fact
that people kind of had preconceived thoughts about us,
people, like, wrote us off.
I definitely feel like I proved myself over time with,

you know, the rest of the people
in the castle when it came to, you know, missions,
when it came to being somebody you can trust.

Emotions do run high,
and people are trying to make it to the end,
and it is sad when people go, and it is about, like, enjoying it together
and building those bonds, experiencing it, being excited,
like, accomplishing things, working together, like, that is awesome.
We're just in this together, and I love that.
I think my fellow castmates would just describe me
as somebody who's enthusiastic and trying his best,
hard worker.
I think they would think I'm funny.
Like, they really like laughing at me, but in an innocent way.
[laughs]
- That last Round Table, I mean, how to go out, right?
I went out with a bang.
Oh my God, I mean, that was so intense.

I wish Britney would have just given me
the opportunity to take that chance.
I was like, “Wow, here we go again.”
Just give me a bone, girl.
I think she had to make a selfish decision to better her gameplay.
I think she was left with no other option in her reality,
that she had to do what she had to do to survive in the game.
You know, I was angry, but at the same time, I get it.
I totally get it.
- I would say number one, Danielle.
Slight possibility of Dolores.
As far as who got recruited, I have no idea.
So my guess would be
Britney or Dylan.
I really hope I'm not wrong.
All right.
Let's see who the Traitor is.
Britney!
Oh my God, no way.
Wow.
That would be my pick for Danielle to recruit,
because they obviously have a bond.
I feel like Britney, she can be very, like, charismatic.
She could, she could turn it on.
- I do adore Britney with all my heart.
That moment where I put that green cloak on her,

I was so giddy because I just felt like,
I wish that's how we were on “Big Brother Reindeer Games.”
Working with her was the best high in the game.
Like, I felt like this is what it should have been,
and I thought for a second we were going to do it,
we're going to pull this off.
That's the time in the whole game
where I feel like I have someone truly, truly in my corner.
- Who the other Traitor is...
Yep, I knew it.
I was right.
And she recruited Britney.
The way she was acting just seemed a little performative,
and she just, to me, became really obvious.
- I played a phenomenal game that I'm not ashamed of.
What I learned about myself, that I'm a great actress.
I mean, good Lord, did you see what I was doing in there?
Oh my God, give me an Emmy for this.
This is crazy.
I'm sure doing a reunion is going to be quite interesting.
And look, I'm going to own it, and I'm going to be apologetic,
I hope they accept my apology.

I need them to understand that, you know,
what I was doing was just for game purposes only,
but at the same time, it wasn't easy.
It was not easy at all.
- We have someone here to see you.
- Okay.
- The person after you who was banished.
- [knocks]
- Come on in, Danielle.
[laughs]
Oh, I knew it.
How are you doing?
- I'm good, I'm sorry I had to murder you.
- That's all right, I understand.
- Yeah.
- I totally understand.
- It came down to a tie breaker.
- It did?
- Yes, and Britney wrote my name down.
- She did.
- Again.
- Argh.
Did Britney tell you that you're going to get banished?
- No, I got blindsided again.
- Damn.
I was on to you, but I was, like...
- Being careful.
- Well, I mean, watching you and Carolyn,

it was so obvious that I was watching two Traitors argue.
- Right.
Carolyn, I, I, I really tried to work with her.
She gave me such a headache dealing with her,
because she would not make a decision.
And I love her to pieces.
- How would you pick somebody then?
- I was playing two games.

When I go into the turret, I had to go, “Okay, whatever you guys want.”
- Jesus.
That sounds so annoying.

- It was, Tom, you had no idea what I was going through.
- Dude, that sounds so annoying.
- I was like, I need to get both of these knuckleheads out of here,
and I need new Traitors because I cannot work with these people.
So let me ask you this question, because I always often wonder,
if I've given you the ultimatum to be a Traitor,
would you have been a Traitor?
- Yeah.

I told people that.
- Really?
- Yeah, I told people that.
- You didn't tell me.
- Aw shit.
- See, I didn't think you would have been one,
because I probably would have picked you if I've known that.
- Fuck.
- You played a great game, Tom.
What the thing is, a lot of people were not listening to you,
but you were making perfect sense.
- Right?
- And I was sitting there,
and I'm like, “He's right, let's, we got to murder this guy,”
but Carolyn wouldn't let me,
like, I was like, Carolyn was protecting you.
So let me ask you this question.
- Mm-hmm.
- What could I have done different?
- [sighs]
- Maybe not putting out there that Carolyn was a Traitor possibly?
- I thought that was a little dirty early on with you,
I think, the nervousness thing
was coming off a little performative,
and I think other people thought that too,
but otherwise, I mean, for you and Carolyn to last as long as you did,

you know, I...
- That's crazy.

- It's great, like, you did a great job.
- Yeah.
- You came across as people that maybe weren't taking us seriously

or were a little like, you know, like,
not the cool kids or something.
And that's how I was too,
so like, I sympathized with that with you guys.
- Yep.
- So in that aspect, you won.
- You know what, Tom?
I stand my ground.
I told you, I watched you on that other show, and I know

you're going to have,
you're still trying to build your reputation,
and I, and I get it.
You know, people make mistakes.
What I know you in that game
and when I know you on that other show,
I have not, I have no ill will towards you,
and I don't care what people say.

I know you, you know what I mean?
- Thank you.
- I mean, I know you were a cheater, but you know, still, you know,

you did what you did, and hopefully you learn from that.
- Yes.
- And become a better person.
- Yes, I did, and that's why it's so important for me

to walk the straight and narrow,
especially after going through that.

- Right, totally.
- I feel like it's been a great experience for everybody.
We've all learned so much about ourselves, each other.
- It was a great season.
- [laughs]
Hell yeah.
